1.text: But now they that are younger than I have me in derision, whose fathers I would have disdained to set with the dogs of my flock.

2.text: Yea, whereto [should] the strength of their hands [profit] me, [men] in whom vigour hath perished?

3.text: Withered up through want and hunger, they flee into waste places long since desolate and desert:

4.text: They gather the salt-wort among the bushes, and the roots of the broom for their food.

5.text: They are driven forth from among [men]—they cry after them as after a thief—

6.text: To dwell in gloomy gorges, in caves of the earth and the rocks:

7.text: They bray among the bushes; under the brambles they are gathered together:

8.text: Sons of fools, and sons of nameless sires, they are driven out of the land.

9.text: And now I am their song, yea, I am their byword.

10.text: They abhor me, they stand aloof from me, yea, they spare not to spit in my face.

11.text: For he hath loosed my cord and afflicted me; so they cast off the bridle before me.

12.text: At [my] right hand rise the young brood; they push away my feet, and raise up against me their pernicious ways;

13.text: They mar my path, they set forward my calamity, without any to help them;

14.text: They come in as through a wide breach: amid the confusion they roll themselves onward.

15.text: Terrors are turned against me; they pursue mine honour as the wind; and my welfare is passed away like a cloud.

16.text: And now my soul is poured out in me; days of affliction have taken hold upon me.

17.text: The night pierceth through my bones [and detacheth them] from me, and my gnawing pains take no rest:

18.text: By their great force they have become my raiment; they bind me about as the collar of my coat.

19.text: He hath cast me into the mire, and I have become like dust and ashes.

20.text: I cry unto thee, and thou answerest me not; I stand up, and thou lookest at me.

21.text: Thou art changed to a cruel one to me; with the strength of thy hand thou pursuest me.

22.text: Thou liftest me up to the wind; thou causest me to be borne away, and dissolvest my substance.

23.text: For I know that thou wilt bring me to death, and into the house of assemblage for all living.

24.text: Indeed, no prayer [availeth] when he stretcheth out [his] hand: though they cry when he destroyeth.

25.text: Did not I weep for him whose days were hard? was not my soul grieved for the needy?

26.text: For I expected good, and there came evil; and I waited for light, but there came darkness.

27.text: My bowels well up, and rest not; days of affliction have confronted me.

28.text: I go about blackened, but not by the sun; I stand up, I cry in the congregation.

29.text: I am become a brother to jackals, and a companion of ostriches.

30.text: My skin is become black [and falleth] off me, and my bones are parched with heat.

31.text: My harp also is [turned] to mourning, and my pipe into the voice of weepers.
